name: monogenically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to or is controlled by a single gene (= part of a cell that is passed on by your parents and that controls physical development, behaviour, etc.): The mutation appears to be monogenically inherited in the cases we have studied. Resistance to the pesticide is thought to be controlled monogenically.
More examplesFewer examplesThese plants have a monogenically inherited resistance to the fungus.Red flower colour was found to be monogenically dominant over white.Bitterness in the fruit is a monogenically inherited characteristic. Resistance to the disease is monogenically inherited.There are several rare monogenically transmitted conditions.
